page.title: 07TRANSPORT
page.content: TRANSPORT People mainly rely on private cars to get around.It is necessary to drive to the nearest railway station to catch a train to London or Portsmouth,and most parents have to drive their over eight year old children to school and home again.Many form a rota to help each other. A bus runs through the village,taking passengers to Farnham or Haslemere,but times are often inconvenient,and fares are costly. Some people use bicycles to get from place to place. The main road through the village carries a large number of heavy lorries,most of which deliver or collect from shops and businesses along their route. Coach transport is always needed for school outings.
